top_categories.workout_context: Grinduro Canada’s mixed terrain demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Grinduro Canada isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Grinduro Canada rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Grinduro Canada when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Grinduro Canada — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Grinduro Canada. Make this intensity feel like home.
Grinduro Canada’s mixed terrain and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Grinduro Canada’s mixed terrain drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Grinduro Canada’s 5,900ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Grinduro Canada — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on mixed terrain.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Grinduro Canada count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Grinduro Canada’s mixed terrain delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Grinduro Canada’s 67 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Grinduro Canada demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 67 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 67 miles of mixed terrain in Saint-Urbain-de-Charlevoix, Quebec, Canada.
